snippet: Jamaica Kincaid says she isn’t writing about her life in her new novel, “See Now Then,” even though it centers on a Caribbean writer with two children married to a composer, just as Ms. Kincaid was.
abstract: Interview with author Jamaica Kincaid, who insists that See Now Then, her first novel in 10 years, is not autobiographical even though the family it describes is much like her own.
lead_paragraph: Jamaica Kincaid says she isn’t writing about her life in her new novel, “See Now Then,” even though it centers on a Caribbean writer with two children married to a composer, just as Ms. Kincaid was.

headline.seo: Jamaica Kincaid Isn’t Writing About Her Life, She Says
headline.main: Never Mind the Parallels, Don’t Read It as My Life
headline.print_headline: Never Mind the Parallels, Don’t Read It as My Life
